params.name: COMMENT_OR_FILE
params.value: There were some errors in your Operator bundle. You can use [this support case]($(tasks.create-support-link-for-pr.results.comment)) to contact the Red Hat certification team for review.

params.name: description
params.value: Failed to certify the Operator bundle.

params.name: description
params.value: Failed to certify the Operator bundle.

params.description: Which environment to run in. Can be one of [dev, qa, stage, prod]
params.name: env

params.description: Must be some variety of quay registry.
params.name: registry

params.description: The namespace/organization all built images will be pushed to.
params.name: image_namespace

params.description: An image of operator-pipeline-images.
params.name: pipeline_image

params.name: github_token_secret_name

params.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret that contains the GitHub token.

conditions.message: "step-certification-project-check" exited with code 1 (image: "quay.io/amisstea/operator-pipelines-images@sha256:01e4902f75eac486608082a3b3d6419a675c841aef25221dbc2a3f135dc16923"); for logs run: kubectl -n amisstea logs operator-hosted-pipeline-run-bvjls-certification-project--dx5rc -c step-certification-project-check

params.name: bundle_path

results.description: Identifier of certification project from Red Hat Connect
results.name: certification_project_id

steps.name: certification-project-check
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
echo "Checking availability of cert project identifier"
exit 1

PKG_PATH=$(dirname $(realpath $(params.bundle_path)))

CI_FILE_PATH="$PKG_PATH/ci.yaml"

CERT_PROJECT_ID=$(cat $CI_FILE_PATH | yq -r '.cert_project_id')

if [ -z $CERT_PROJECT_ID ]; then
  echo "Certification project ID is missing in ci.yaml file (cert_project_id)"
  exit 1
fi

echo -n $CERT_PROJECT_ID | tee $(results.certification_project_id.path)

taskSpec.description:
These Tasks are Git tasks to work with repositories used by other tasks in your Pipeline.
The git-clone Task will clone a repo from the provided url into the output Workspace. By default the repo will be cloned into the root of your Workspace. You can clone into a subdirectory by setting this Task's subdirectory param. This Task also supports sparse checkouts. To perform a sparse checkout, pass a list of comma separated directory patterns to this Task's sparseCheckoutDirectories param.

params.description: Repository URL to clone from.
params.name: url

params.description: Revision to checkout. (branch, tag, sha, ref, etc...)
params.name: revision

params.description: Refspec to fetch before checking out revision.
params.name: refspec

params.description: Initialize and fetch git submodules.
params.name: submodules

params.description: Perform a shallow clone, fetching only the most recent N commits.
params.name: depth

params.description: Set the `http.sslVerify` global git config. Setting this to `false` is not advised unless you are sure that you trust your git remote.
params.name: sslVerify

params.description: Subdirectory inside the `output` Workspace to clone the repo into.
params.name: subdirectory

params.description: Define the directory patterns to match or exclude when performing a sparse checkout.
params.name: sparseCheckoutDirectories

params.description: Clean out the contents of the destination directory if it already exists before cloning.
params.name: deleteExisting

params.description: HTTP proxy server for non-SSL requests.
params.name: httpProxy

params.description: HTTPS proxy server for SSL requests.
params.name: httpsProxy

params.description: Opt out of proxying HTTP/HTTPS requests.
params.name: noProxy

params.description: Log the commands that are executed during `git-clone`'s operation.
params.name: verbose

params.description: The image providing the git-init binary that this Task runs.
params.name: gitInitImage

params.description:
Absolute path to the user's home directory. Set this explicitly if you are running the image as a non-root user or have overridden
the gitInitImage param with an image containing custom user configuration.
params.name: userHome

results.description: The precise commit SHA that was fetched by this Task.
results.name: commit

results.description: The precise URL that was fetched by this Task.
results.name: url

steps.name: clone
steps.script:
#!/usr/bin/env sh
set -eu

if [ "${PARAM_VERBOSE}" = "true" ] ; then
  set -x
fi

if [ "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" = "true" ] ; then
  cp "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/.git-credentials" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.git-credentials"
  cp "${WORKSPACE_BASIC_AUTH_DIRECTORY_PATH}/.gitconfig" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.gitconfig"
  chmod 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.git-credentials"
  chmod 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}/.gitconfig"
fi

if [ "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_BOUND}" = "true" ] ; then
  cp -R "${WORKSPACE_SSH_DIRECTORY_PATH}" "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh
  chmod 700 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh
  chmod -R 400 "${PARAM_USER_HOME}"/.ssh/*
fi

CHECKOUT_DIR="${WORKSPACE_OUTPUT_PATH}/${PARAM_SUBDIRECTORY}"

cleandir() {
  # Delete any existing contents of the repo directory if it exists.
  #
  # We don't just "rm -rf ${CHECKOUT_DIR}" because ${CHECKOUT_DIR} might be "/"
  # or the root of a mounted volume.
  if [ -d "${CHECKOUT_DIR}" ] ; then
    # Delete non-hidden files and directories
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR:?}"/*
    # Delete files and directories starting with . but excluding ..
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"/.[!.]*
    # Delete files and directories starting with .. plus any other character
    rm -rf "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"/..?*
  fi
}

if [ "${PARAM_DELETE_EXISTING}" = "true" ] ; then
  cleandir
fi

test -z "${PARAM_HTTP_PROXY}" || export HTTP_PROXY="${PARAM_HTTP_PROXY}"
test -z "${PARAM_HTTPS_PROXY}" || export HTTPS_PROXY="${PARAM_HTTPS_PROXY}"
test -z "${PARAM_NO_PROXY}" || export NO_PROXY="${PARAM_NO_PROXY}"

/ko-app/git-init \
  -url="${PARAM_URL}" \
  -revision="${PARAM_REVISION}" \
  -refspec="${PARAM_REFSPEC}" \
  -path="${CHECKOUT_DIR}" \
  -sslVerify="${PARAM_SSL_VERIFY}" \
  -submodules="${PARAM_SUBMODULES}" \
  -depth="${PARAM_DEPTH}" \
  -sparseCheckoutDirectories="${PARAM_SPARSE_CHECKOUT_DIRECTORIES}"
cd "${CHECKOUT_DIR}"
RESULT_SHA="$(git rev-parse HEAD)"
EXIT_CODE="$?"
if [ "${EXIT_CODE}" != 0 ] ; then
  exit "${EXIT_CODE}"
fi
printf "%s" "${RESULT_SHA}" > "$(results.commit.path)"
printf "%s" "${PARAM_URL}" > "$(results.url.path)"

workspaces.description: The git repo will be cloned onto the volume backing this Workspace.
workspaces.name: output

workspaces.description:
A .ssh directory with private key, known_hosts, config, etc. Copied to
the user's home before git commands are executed. Used to authenticate
with the git remote when performing the clone. Binding a Secret to this
Workspace is strongly recommended over other volume types.
workspaces.name: ssh-directory

workspaces.description:
A Workspace containing a .gitconfig and .git-credentials file. These
will be copied to the user's home before any git commands are run. Any
other files in this Workspace are ignored. It is strongly recommended
to use ssh-directory over basic-auth whenever possible and to bind a
Secret to this Workspace over other volume types.
workspaces.name: basic-auth

steps.name: compute-md5sum
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
set -xe
echo "Compute md5hash of bundle content..."

find $(params.bundle_path) -not -name "Dockerfile" -type f | \
  tr '\n' '\0' | \
  xargs -r0 -I {} md5sum "{}" | \
  sort >> hashes.txt

cat hashes.txt

md5sum hashes.txt | awk '{ print $1 }' | tr -d $'\n' | tee $(results.md5sum.path)

steps.name: get-bundle-path

taskSpec.description: This task adds a PipelineRun summary comment to a GitHub pull request.

params.description: The GitHub host, adjust this if you run a GitHub enteprise.
params.name: github_host_url

params.description: The API path prefix, GitHub Enterprise has a prefix e.g. /api/v3
params.name: api_path_prefix

params.description:
The GitHub issue or pull request URL where we want to add a new
comment.
params.name: request_url

params.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret that contains the GitHub token.
params.name: github_token_secret_name

params.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret that contains the GitHub token.
params.name: github_token_secret_key

params.description: The name of the PipelineRun to summarize.
params.name: pipelinerun

params.description: The common pipeline image.
params.name: pipeline_image

params.description: A comment to append to the end of the summary
params.name: comment_suffix

steps.name: gather-info
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
set -xe

PR_NAME="$(params.pipelinerun)"
mkdir $PR_NAME

echo "Getting PipelineRun details"
tkn pipelinerun describe $PR_NAME -o json > $PR_NAME/pipelinerun.json

echo "Getting TaskRun details"
tkn taskrun list \
  --label 'tekton.dev/pipelineRun'=="$PR_NAME" \
  -o jsonpath='{.items}' \
  > $PR_NAME/taskruns.json

chmod -R 777 $PR_NAME

steps.name: build-comment
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
set -xe

PR_NAME="$(params.pipelinerun)"

pipelinerun-summary $PR_NAME/pipelinerun.json $PR_NAME/taskruns.json \
  > $PR_NAME/comment.md

if [ ! -z "$(params.comment_suffix)" ]; then
  echo "$(params.comment_suffix)" >> $PR_NAME/comment.md
fi

steps.name: post-comment
steps.script:
#!/usr/libexec/platform-python
import json
import os
import sys
import http.client
import urllib.parse

split_url = urllib.parse.urlparse(
    "$(params.request_url)").path.split("/")

# This will convert https://github.com/foo/bar/pull/202 to
# api url path /repos/foo/issues/
api_url = "{base}/repos/{package}/issues/{id}".format(
  base="", package="/".join(split_url[1:3]), id=split_url[-1])

with open("$(params.pipelinerun)/comment.md") as fh:
  data = {"body": fh.read()}

conn = http.client.HTTPSConnection("$(params.github_host_url)")

method = "POST"
target_url = api_url + "/comments"

print("Sending this data to GitHub with {}: ".format(method))
print(data)
r = conn.request(
    method,
    target_url,
    body=json.dumps(data),
    headers={
        "User-Agent": "TektonCD, the peaceful cat",
        "Authorization": "Bearer " + os.environ["GITHUBTOKEN"],
    })
resp = conn.getresponse()

if not str(resp.status).startswith("2"):
    print("Error: %d" % (resp.status))
    print(resp.read())
    sys.exit(1)
else:
    print("A GitHub comment has been added to $(params.request_url)")

workspaces.description: Scratch space and storage for the comment
workspaces.name: output

params.description: Environment. One of [dev, qa, stage, prod]
params.name: env

params.description: Pyxis access type. One of [internal, external]
params.name: access_type

results.description: Container API URL based for selected environment
results.name: pyxis_url

results.description: Target branch for submitted PR in upstream repository
results.name: target_branch

results.description: Connect SPA URL based on selected environment
results.name: connect_url

results.description: Connect container registry proxy based on selected environment
results.name: connect_registry

results.description: IIB URL based on selected environment
results.name: iib_url

steps.name: set-env
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

ENV="$(params.env)"
ACCESS_TYPE="$(params.access_type)"

if ! [[ "$ACCESS_TYPE" =~ ^(internal|external)$ ]]; then
    echo "Unknown access type."
    exit 1
fi

case $ENV in
    prod)
        case $ACCESS_TYPE in
            internal)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis.engineering.redhat.com"
            ;;
            external)
            PYXIS_URL="https://catalog.redhat.com/api/containers/"
            ;;
        esac
        TARGET_BRANCH="main"
        CONNECT_URL="https://connect.redhat.com"
        CONNECT_REGISTRY="registry.connect.redhat.com"
        IIB_URL="https://iib.engineering.redhat.com"
    ;;
    stage)
        case $ACCESS_TYPE in
            internal)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis.isv.stage.engineering.redhat.com"
            ;;
            external)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis-isv-stage.api.redhat.com"
            ;;
        esac
        TARGET_BRANCH="stage"
        CONNECT_URL="https://connect.stage.redhat.com"
        CONNECT_REGISTRY="registry.connect.stage.redhat.com"
        IIB_URL="https://iib.stage.engineering.redhat.com"
    ;;
    qa)
        case $ACCESS_TYPE in
            internal)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis.isv.qa.engineering.redhat.com"
            ;;
            external)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis-isv-qa.api.redhat.com"
            ;;
        esac
        TARGET_BRANCH="qa"
        CONNECT_URL="https://connect.qa.redhat.com"
        CONNECT_REGISTRY="registry.connect.qa.redhat.com"
        IIB_URL="https://iib.stage.engineering.redhat.com"
    ;;
    dev)
        case $ACCESS_TYPE in
            internal)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis.isv.dev.engineering.redhat.com"
            ;;
            external)
            PYXIS_URL="https://pyxis-isv-dev.api.redhat.com"
            ;;
        esac
        TARGET_BRANCH="dev"
        CONNECT_URL="https://connect.dev.redhat.com"
        CONNECT_REGISTRY="registry.connect.dev.redhat.com"
        IIB_URL="https://iib.stage.engineering.redhat.com"
    ;;
    *)
        echo "Unknown environment."
        exit 1
        ;;
esac

echo -n $PYXIS_URL | tee $(results.pyxis_url.path)
echo -n $TARGET_BRANCH | tee $(results.target_branch.path)
echo -n $CONNECT_URL | tee $(results.connect_url.path)
echo -n $CONNECT_REGISTRY | tee $(results.connect_registry.path)
echo -n $IIB_URL | tee $(results.iib_url.path)

params.description: SHA of the commit to set the status for.
params.name: commit_sha

params.description: Description attached to the github status.
params.name: description

params.description: The github status to set for the given commit.
params.name: state

params.description: Context attached to the github status.
params.name: context

params.description: URL to more details about the status.
params.name: target_url

params.description: Flag to skip the setting of github status.
params.name: skip

params.description: The name of the Kubernetes Secret that contains the GitHub token.
params.name: github_token_secret_name

params.description: The key within the Kubernetes Secret that contains the GitHub token.
params.name: github_token_secret_key

steps.name: set-github-status
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
# Don't use set -x to avoid exposing github token
set -e

if [ $(params.skip) == "true" ]; then
  echo "Skipping setting github status"
  exit 0
fi

echo "Setting github status of commit $(params.commit_sha) to $(params.state)"

set-github-status \
  --git-repo-url "$(params.git_repo_url)" \
  --commit-sha "$(params.commit_sha)" \
  --status "$(params.state)" \
  --context "$(params.context)" \
  --description "$(params.description)" \
  --target-url "$(params.target_url)"

steps.name: submission-validation
steps.script:
#! /usr/bin/env bash
set -xe

# Parse PR title to see, whether it complies the regex.
# Get the operator name and version from PR title.
verify-pr-title \
  --pr-title "$(params.git_pr_title)" \
  --verbose

cat bundle_name | tee $(results.operator_name.path)
cat bundle_version | tee $(results.bundle_version.path)
